title.native: ジョジョの奇妙な冒険 ストーンオーシャン
title.romaji: JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken: Stone Ocean

description:
In Florida, 2011, Jolyne Kuujou sits in a jail cell like her father Joutarou once did; yet this situation is not of her own choice. Framed for a crime she didn’t commit, and manipulated into serving a longer sentence, Jolyne is ready to resign to a dire fate as a prisoner of Green Dolphin Street Jail. Though all hope seems lost, a gift from Joutarou ends up awakening her latent abilities, manifesting into her Stand, Stone Free. Now armed with the power to change her fate, Jolyne sets out to find an escape from the stone ocean that holds her.

However, she soon discovers that her incarceration is merely a small part of a grand plot: one that not only takes aim at her family, but has additional far-reaching consequences. What's more, the mastermind is lurking within the very same prison, and is under the protection of a lineup of menacing Stand users. Finding unlikely allies to help her cause, Jolyne sets course to stop their plot, clear her name, and take back her life.

(Source: MAL Rewrite)
synonyms: JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken Part 6

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.name: Police
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of law enforcement officers.

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Fugitive
tags.description: Prominently features a character evading capture by an individual or organization.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Prison
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a prison.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Body Horror
tags.description: Features characters who undergo horrific transformations or disfigurement, often to their own detriment.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Memory Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) who has had their memories altered.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Shapeshifting
tags.description: Features character(s) who changes one's appearance or form.

tags.name: Agender
tags.description: Prominently features agender characters.

tags.name: Ghost
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a ghost.

tags.name: Masturbation
tags.description: Features erotic stimulation of one's own genitalia or other erogenous regions.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Disability
tags.description: A work that features one or more characters with a physical, mental, cognitive, or developmental condition that impairs, interferes with, or limits the person's ability to engage in certain tasks or actions.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

node.description:
Hirohiko Araki is a manga artist. He left school before graduation from Miyagi University of Education.  

Araki is best known for his long-running series JoJo's Bizarre Adventure, published in Weekly Shonen Jump starting in 1987. The story is full of references to Western music and Italy, both of which Araki is reportedly very fond. Many of Araki's creations have been translated and released in Europe but so far only JoJo's Bizarre Adventure and Baoh have been released in the United States. One popular theory is that Araki's frequent references to Western music may violate American copyright laws. Viz has eluded much of this problem in JoJo's Bizarre Adventure by replacing some band references with album or song references, which do not appear to be as strictly guarded. Araki is a recipient of the Tezuka Award.   

(Source: JoJo's Bizarre Encyclopedia)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1059938929485344774)

Freelance animator and designer. Formerly affiliated with [David Production](https://anilist.co/studio/287) and known for his extensive work on the *Jojo's Bizarre Adventure* anime series.
She was nicknamed "Yasuko Nyan" by her godfather Naomi Takebe, a producer at [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/Toei-Animation).
Houtani Yukitoshi (宝谷幸稔) is a Japanese animator, animation director, illustrator and character designer.

**[Twitter](https://twitter.com/editzhirose)** | **[Website](http://www.editz.jp/)**

**Hirose Kiyoshi** is a Japanese editor and film editor.

[Profile](https://asahi-pro.co.jp/creator/yamada-kazuhiro)

Affiliated with Asahi Production.

_Note: Not to be confused with the other [composite artist](https://anilist.co/staff/252146/) by the same name._
_Note: not to be confused with the [animator](https://anilist.co/staff/169408/)._

Shouko Fujibayashi is a Japanese lyricist and musician. Shouko has written the lyrics for many television series' theme songs as well as several theme songs for tokusatsu shows. Most recently, Fujibayashi has worked with Shuhei Naruse on the sountracks of Kamen Rider Den-O, Kamen Rider Kiva, and their films respectively. She also worked with BoA, Ken Hirai, Sowelu, Mikuni Shimokawa, Crystal Kay, Beni Arashiro, ISSA of DA PUMP, Lead and Miho Kanno. Shouko made her debut in 1995 with Wonderful Bravo, an image song for the anime TV series, Gokudou-kun. She works for Office Two-One.
__Takao Kawada__ is a Japanese lyricist, composer and arranger.

__[Profile (Obelisk)](http://obelisk.co.jp/c_iehara.html)__

__Masaki Iehara__ is a Japanese composer and arranger, who has worked as as an arranger for Asami Katagiri (under Epic Sony record label). He has also worked for Scoop Music as a CM Producer, and as an arranger for several artists. He currently works for Obelisk Inc.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ichiRingo) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/ichiringo/)

ichigo is the vocalist of [Kishida Kyoudan & The Akeboshi Rockets](https://anilist.co/staff/112181/Kishida-Kyoudan--The-Akeboshi-Rockets).

Freelancer. Recognizable for his bassy and often reverbed sound effects.

Regularly works with [Yoshikazu Iwanami](https://anilist.co/staff/101016/) and [Jin Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/103074/).
